title: Why has Tamil Nadu rejected the 3 language policy in the NEP 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: The 3 language formula has been around since 1968. Tell me how many of the Hindi speaking Northern states have learnt a third language. Tell me how many schools or colleges in Hindi speaking Northern states teach a third language, whether it be Bengali, Oriyya, Gujrati, or Marati, or, heaven forbid, a Madraasi language. India is a country made up of many ancient nations. We all have long histories. Till the Britishers took over India, there was no one country called India. Even the great emperor Asoka did not force his dominion to use one language. And if you are one of those, who does not know history, Asoka’s empire did not include the Southern India. We call ourselves a Republic, and have no idea about what a Republic is. Some of us (the very people who clamor for Hindi as the language that should bind all Indians) very proudly talk about all their imaginary Maha Janapadas bullshit!!! What an irony!!! Whether you like it or not, the only language that binds us, you guessed it, is English. Don’t worry, an average Englishman or an American has a tough time understanding your English. The English you speak is your very own. A worthless piece of garbage who sought refuge in my state by name Aurobindo Gosh, never learnt Tamil even after staying there for more than half his life. It is said that piece of garbage knew 30 languages. Such is the level of contempt from all North Indians towards S.Indians. Every Bengali should hang his head in shame for having produced a worthless piece of low-class garbage like Aurobindo Gosh. The primary reason why the Hindian controlled, Central Indian govt pushes for Hindi has to do with the number of MPs from Hindi speaking states. Whereas the Southern states implemented family planning and two children policy, the Hindi speakers went on reproducing the way they always did. And now they have more MPs.!!! This was pointed out by none other than Sashi Tharoor. Don’t tell me Narendar Lodi is not a Hindi speaker. He is a low-class Gujarati Bania, who has no morals or ethics. He will sell India to the Chinese if he can make a good profit. Addendum: From Wikpedia on 3 language policy. C. N. Annadurai, the Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu during 1967–1969, opposed the requirement to learn Hindi in Tamil Nadu, "What serves to link us with the outside world is certainly capable of rendering the same service inside India as well. To plead for two link languages is like boring a smaller hole in a wall for the kitten while there is a bigger one for the cat. What suits the cat will suit the kitten as well." [6] He was willing to adopt the formula in Tamil Nadu only on the condition that all other states of India too would adopt it. [7] Academics have noted the failure of the formula. Harold F. Schiffman, an expert on Dravidian culture at the University of Pennsylvania, observed that the formula "has been honored in the breach more than in reality" and that due to the lack of a symbolic national language, there is a tendency "for English to take over as the instrumental language" in India. [8] Political scientist Brian Weinstein of Howard University said that "neither Hindi nor non-Hindi speaking states followed the (1968) directive". [2] References
